company.name: PointSource, LLC
company.title: Software Engineer (Senior-Level, Front-End, JavaScript Web Applications)

roles: Conceived and delivered a modular, highly-customized form interface (UI) using AngularJS
Flexibly implemented client-requested UX, design and data model changes, during year of agile iterations
Helped company earn a multi-year contract extension through high-quality deliveries
Front-end leadership and management contributions on a cross-disciplinary team:
subroles: Collaborated with design leads on theming and user experience (UX); CSS/Sass expertise to bring designs to life
Worked with backend developers to flush out and model RESTful APIs
Consumed JSON endpoints for concurrent users, handling asynchronous responses with promises
Onboarded and empowered new front-end teammates when the project ramped up
Oversaw growth of client-side unit test coverage to minimize regressions
Supervised Git repository for the UI development branch, providing code reviews and merging pull requests
Managed continuous integration, to automate builds/deployments to the testing environment
Prioritized daily communication with offsite project management and offshore QA team, to help unblock teammates, monitor acceptance criteria, and facilitate division of labor
Proposed and influenced agile methodologies, improving sprint planning and estimates
Drafted flow-chart for new employee deck, visualizing how remote offices might improve collaborations

roles: Two years building enterprise applications and marketing sites with AngularJS, ReactJS and related front-end technologies
Cutting edge JavaScript (ES5, ES6/ES2015)
Demonstrated proficiency with CSS and theming techniques; Worked closely with designer/UX leads
Promoted to front-end leadership after first performance review.
Final project was nominated for an Acquia Engage Award, in the 'Decoupled Drupal' category
Helped a small GIS (Geographic Information Systems) team build MVC JavaScript map applications for the telecommunications industry using Sencha's ExtJS framework and the Bing Maps API
Emerged as team’s front-end specialist, providing custom jQuery components and CMS templates
Took ownership of content inventories and helped coordinate front-end efforts with project managers and designers
Authored specifications and performed client-facing tasks
Through our team's efforts, the company reported a 40% profit growth, best in company history
Merged design and GIS skills to create strategy maps for the tutor/mentor community, at a student-based non-profit organization
Wore several leadership hats: Organizer for a successful benefit concert fund-raiser, curator of a public map gallery, and volunteer teacher for the program's 10th grade 'Tech Club'
Developed philosophies on leadership and social behavior during pursuit of graduate level degree in Education, while concurrently teaching/tutoring CPS high school freshmen and sophomores
Built and maintained custom Visual Basic plug-ins in a multinational corporate environment
Received formal SQL training; Two-years developing PL/SQL programs to process real-time NFL game day data, while simultaneously converting legacy NFL data to Oracle 9i
Worked another two years in STATS' fantasy sports department, developing web applications and user interfaces with XHTML, ASP, and ODBC

items.desc: ECMAScript (ES5, ES6, Babel); Libraries (ReactJS/Flux/Redux, jQuery 2.x, Underscore, Lodash); MV* frameworks (AngularJS 1.x); Mobile hybrid (Ionic 1.x)

Hand-coded HTML5/CSS3; Adaptive layouts; Responsive grids; Precompilers (Sass, Less); UI frameworks (Bootstrap 3.x, Material Design, Foundation); Templating (Handlebars); SVG; CSS transitions/animations

API planning/design; Endpoint consumption (REST); Asynchronous requests/responses (promises, AJAX, callbacks); JSON, XML; Client-side authentication (JWT); Concurrent user support, Mapping APIs (Google, Bing, OpenStreetMap)
Middleware (Node.js, Express); SQL, MySQL 5.x; NoSQL (MongoDB, Mongoose ODM); SQL Server 2012; Oracle 9i; PL/SQL; Schema design; Real-time data; GIS/Geodata (ESRI)
Unit testing (Karma, Mocha/Chai/Sinon); ESLint; W3C validators; Cross-browser; Continuous integration (Jenkins)
Task runners/bundlers (Gulp, Grunt, webpack); Version control (Git, GitHub); Package managers (npm, Bower, Yarn)
UX ('Co-Design'); UI Prototypes; Adobe CC 2015 (Photoshop, Illustrator); Marketing/branding materials; Music/video production
Knows where to look for answers and when to ask questions; Able to quickly adapt new technologies and client requirements; Humbled by the industry – always anxious to learn more

Self-monitoring if required, but an agile team-player at heart; Just as happy with the assist as I am scoring the goal; Prizes mutual respect, trust, collaboration, and the rare 'jelled team'; Open to new ideas and never the 'derailer' in the room

Shares information and communicates in timely manner so others aren’t blocked; Recently called 'thorough' in my detail orientation and preparation; Not afraid to raise hand when I feel something is wrong, lost, offtrack or forgotten

Graduate degree in Education; Experienced with managing front-end processes; Experienced with consulting, onboarding and mentoring; Reflective with a developing leadership philosophy; Strong believer in 'lead by example'
Independently wrote, produced, designed and promoted two full-length records, self-released in 2007 and 2012
experience: Technology: Sound Production; Audio Engineering/Mastering; Video Production
Design: Marketing Materials (Logos, Posters, Press Releases); CD Production Templates
Marketing/Leadership: Social Media; Editorial Calendars; Media Outreach; Artist Management
